intro: Lobelia cymbalaria, commonly known as the spurred lobelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lobelia cymbalaria is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can also serve as a nectar source for pollinators.
